docs.lead_paragraph: Tax experts from the United States and 19 other Western Hemispheric nations will meet in a "hemispheric tax summit" in Panama beginning April 30 to establish a permanent interAmerican center for tax administration, according to the director of the Internal Revenue Service's Manhattan District.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 3--The- Senate Foreign Relations Committee adopted today a watereddown version of the resolution of support that President Johnson hopes to take to a Western Hemisphere summit meeting next week. Administration officials immediately...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 3--The- Senate Foreign Relations Committee adopted today a watereddown version of the resolution of support that President Johnson hopes to take to a Western Hemisphere summit meeting next week. Administration officials immediately denounced the new language as "worse than useless" and pressed for its revision.
docs.abstract: Sen Foreign Relations Com, 9-0, adopts diluted version of resolution pledging US aid to Latin-Amer common mkt; 4 Sens, reptdly including Morse, abstain; Adm officials denounce wording as 'worse than useless,' press for revision before summit conf; Johnson seeks measure to help prod Latin-Amers toward econ integration; direct clash with Fulbright seen; he refuses to give Adm 'blank check,'

byline.original: By MAX FRANKEL Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: The State Department expressed concern yesterday that North Vietnam might be using mental or physical pressure on American prisoners to obtain confessions. A spokesman noted an article in Life magazine reporting a captured American officer's...
docs.lead_paragraph: The State Department expressed concern yesterday that North Vietnam might be using mental or physical pressure on American prisoners to obtain confessions. A spokesman noted an article in Life magazine reporting a captured American officer's appearance before foreign newsmen in Hanoi and confessing to war crimes. The State Department said there have been other indications in the past of brainwashing techniques being employed on U.S. prisoners.

headline.main: News Summary and Index; The Major Events of the Day

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 4-- President Johnson was reported today to be resigned to abandoning his drive for Senate approval of a resolution to strengthen his hand for the Western Hemisphere summit meeting next week.
